gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਨਰਿੰਦ ਚੜ੍ਹਿ ਬੈਠਤ ਪ੍ਰਯੰਕ ਪਰ ਚਾਰੋ ਖੂਟ ਸੈ ਦਰਬ ਦੇਤ ਅਾਨਿ ਅਾਨਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Narind Charhhi Baitthat Prayank Para , Chaaro Khoot Sai Darab Dayt Aani Aani Kai ?
translation: Just as when a king comes and sits on his throne, people from all over come to him with their problems and petitions or offerings,

gurmukhi: ਕਾਹੂ ਕੳੁ ਰਿਸਾੲਿ ਅਾਗਯਾ ਕਰਤ ਜੳੁ ਮਾਰਬੇ ਕੀ ਤਾਤਕਾਲ ਮਾਰਿ ਡਾਰੀਅਤ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਹਾਨ ਕੈ
transliteration: Kaahoo Kau Risaai Aagayaa Karat Jau Maarabay Kee , Taatakaal Maari Daareeat Praan Haan Kai ?
translation: And if the king angrily orders killing of a culprit, that person is executed at once.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਹੂ ਕੳੁ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਦਿਖਾਵਤ ਹੈ ਲਾਖ ਕੋਟਿ ਤੁਰਤ ਭੰਡਾਰੀ ਗਨ ਦੇਤਿ ਅਾਨ ਮਾਨਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Kaahoo Kau Prasann Hvai Dikhaavat Hai Laakh Koti , Turat Bhandaaree Gan Dayti Aan Maani Kai ?
translation: And pleased with some noble and virtuous person, he orders giving millions of rupees to the honoured person, the cashier obeys the order and brings the required money immediately.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਦੇਤ ਲੇਤ ਹੇਤ ਨੇਤ ਕੈ ਬ੍ਹਮਗਯਾਨੀ ਲੇਪ ਨ ਲਿਪਤ ਹੈ ਬ੍ਹਮਗਯਾਨ ਸਯਾਨ ਕੈ ||੬੧੮||
transliteration: Taisay Dayt Layt Hayt Nayt Kai Brahamagayaanee , Layp N Lipat Hai Brahamagayaan Sayaan Kai ?618?
translation: Just as a king remains impartial while passing judgment on a culprit or a noble person, so does an enlightened person feels God Almighty as the cause of all comforts and tribulations to human being and he himself remains aloof of these being a knower of L
